unnormalised: **Inventory Forecasting Crucial for Manufacturing Sector in India**
normalised: **Inventory Forecasting Crucial for Manufacturing Sector in India**

unnormalised: Mumbai, India – 20/10/2023 – A recent study by the Indian Institute of Supply Chain Management (IISCM) highlights the critical role of accurate inventory forecasting in bolstering the competitiveness of Indian manufacturers. The report, released at 14:00 hrs today, underscores how improved forecasting can significantly reduce warehousing costs and minimize stockouts, especially during peak demand seasons like Diwali.
normalised: Mumbai, India – twentieth october two thousand and twenty three – A recent study by the Indian Institute of Supply Chain Management (I I S C M) highlights the critical role of accurate inventory forecasting in bolstering the competitiveness of Indian manufacturers. The report, released at fourteen hundred hours today, underscores how improved forecasting can significantly reduce warehousing costs and minimize stockouts, especially during peak demand seasons like Diwali.

unnormalised: "Businesses like Tata Steel and Reliance Industries can optimize raw material procurement schedules through predictive analytics," stated Dr. Aisha Sharma, lead researcher at IISCM. The study further recommends embracing AI and machine learning for enhanced demand prediction, particularly for industries dealing with perishable goods or rapidly evolving consumer preferences. With the festive season fast approaching, companies are urged to revisit their forecasting models by 31/10/2023 to ensure optimal stock levels. This strategic move can prevent lost sales and improve customer satisfaction, crucial for sustained growth in the dynamic Indian market. Failure to adopt advanced forecasting techniques could lead to inventory losses of up to 15%, impacting profitability and market share. The next webinar on this will be held on 27/10/2023.
